item.title: Bridge returned error 500! (18611)
item.content:encoded:
abolishicedenver - Instagram Bridge was unable to receive or process the remote website's content!
Error message: `Unable to find username in search result.`
Query string: `action=display&bridge=Instagram&context=Username&u=abolishicedenver&media_type=all&direct_links=on&format=Atom`
Version: `dev.2020-02-26`

  • Press Return to check your input parameters
  • Press F5 to retry
  • Check if this issue was already reported on GitHub (give it a thumbs-up)
  • Open a GitHub Issue if this error persists

pauder

item.title: The case of Elijah McClain’s murder by Aurora Police and...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

The case of Elijah McClain’s murder by Aurora Police and paramedics was on 60 Minutes last night.

“Excited Delirium”: the latest pseudoscientific justification for racist state terror

"Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports.

cbsnews.com

How a questionable syndrome, "Excited Delirium," could be protecting police officers from misconduct charges

"Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports."Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: “With negotiations at an impasse, the contract went to a...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

“With negotiations at an impasse, the contract went to a third-party arbitrator to decide who gets what. Each side — the city government and the police Denver Police Protective Association — was to give its final offers to the decider, who would choose one or the other.

The union’s final offer, the lowest raise it would accept, was identical to the original contract — 2.8 percent. But Mayor Hancock and the council could not agree on a figure, so they submitted nothing. The arbitrator gave police the raise they asked for.”

The new contract passed 10 to 3.

denverite.com

How Denver police officers secured a nearly 3% raise even though city council didn’t want to give them one

The new contract passed 10 to 3.The new contract passed 10 to 3.
item.author: Abolish ICE Denver

item.title: Via Comrade Shontel Lewis - RTD Director for District B I...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Via Comrade Shontel Lewis - RTD Director for District B

I don’t know if you all have been paying attention to the egregious actions of Governor Jared S Polis . He has rejected the science and has relied on his bias, inserting his beliefs and feelings into when and whom have access to the vaccine. He used his authority to change the recommendation.

We all know someone that is in jail, prison and/or sometime experiencing homelessness. To deny them early access to the vaccine ...is criminal but since we are talking about people that society has deem as invaluable this is acceptable. Don’t let this slide.

I know you all are busy. But can you please do me a favor and contact your State Representative and Senators.

I know it can be scary to speak truth to power — but you can and you must. We cannot accept that someone sentenced to a two year prison sentence is not only now on 24 hour lock down, but sentenced to death because they are denied early access to the vaccine.

Those are our brothers, sisters, cousins that are being forgotten about.

Your reps need to hear from you. Email and call, tell them to follow the science and not allow the personal feeling they have toward to those in prisons and jails cloud their judgment.

See MoreThis website requires javascript to run optimally on computers, mobile devices, and screen readers. Please enable javascript for the best experience!

leg.colorado.gov

Find My Legislator | Colorado General Assembly

item.title: #FreeThemAll In York, ICE has reported nine active cases for a...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

#FreeThemAll

In York, ICE has reported nine active cases for a total of 117, with a spike in September. Pike County Prison has eight active cases, bringing the total to 32. Cambria County Jail had 11 total reported cases, though none are active. Clinton County Correctional Facility’s mid-November outbreak has resulted in 55 total cases and 52 active infections among ICE detainees, more current cases than ICE was reporting in any of the other facilities as of Dec. 9. The data does not reflect a case reported at Berks County Residential Center, where a member of the medical staff tested positive in October and immediately resigned.

https://www.witf.org/…/demonstrators-in-york-call-for-rele…/

At a vigil outside York County Prison on Thursday evening, leaders from several groups spoke and played testimony from people who had been detained – or had loved ones detained – in the building across the parking lot.

witf.org

Demonstrators in York call for releases from immigration detention | WITF

At a vigil outside York County Prison on Thursday evening, leaders from several groups spoke and played testimony from people who had been detained – or had loved ones detained – in the building across the parking lot.At a vigil outside York County Prison on Thursday evening, leaders from several groups spoke and played testimony from people who had been detained – or had loved ones detained – in the building across the parking lot.

item.title: “Police and protesters collided outside the Bergen County Jail...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

“Police and protesters collided outside the Bergen County Jail on a damp and foggy Saturday evening, capping a long day of protests in the county's largest city as demonstrators rallied for hours in support of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement detainees on hunger strike inside the jail.”

Protesters and police clashed Saturday outside the Bergen County Jail, where three ICE detainees continued a hunger strike over jail conditions.

northjersey.com

Police, protesters clash near Bergen County Jail as ICE detainees continue hunger strike

Protesters and police clashed Saturday outside the Bergen County Jail, where three ICE detainees continued a hunger strike over jail conditions.Protesters and police clashed Saturday outside the Bergen County Jail, where three ICE detainees continued a hunger strike over jail conditions.

item.title: The impact of ICE’s failure to adequately respond to the...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

The impact of ICE’s failure to adequately respond to the pandemic was far reaching and multilayered.

Even as COVID-19 cases have surged across the country, ICE has ramped up enforcement activities, creating a recipe for disaster for those in detention and surrounding communities.

Read Detention Watch Network's new report, Hotbeds of Infection: bit.ly/ICEHotbeds

A Detention Watch Network report blames ICE for nearly a quarter-million coronavirus cases throughout the country.

theintercept.com

ICE Mismanagement Created Coronavirus “Hotbeds of Infection” In and Around Detention Centers

A Detention Watch Network report blames ICE for nearly a quarter-million coronavirus cases throughout the country.A Detention Watch Network report blames ICE for nearly a quarter-million coronavirus cases throughout the country.

item.title: "There’s nothing for us, no way to work, to make a...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"There’s nothing for us, no way to work, to make a living,” he said, waiting in the bus station, his infant bawling hysterically behind him. “We’re destroyed here.”

“The conditions driving migration before the two hurricanes hit were already awful, and people were struggling with the economic insecurity of the pandemic,” Karen Spring, a Canadian activist and coordinator for the Honduras Solidarity Network, told TNH. “On top of that, people are stuck with an illegitimate government.”

After back-to-back hurricanes, hundreds of Hondurans have decided enough is enough and are heading north to the United States.

thenewhumanitarian.org

Honduran storm survivors form US-bound migrant caravan

After back-to-back hurricanes, hundreds of Hondurans have decided enough is enough and are heading north to the United States.After back-to-back hurricanes, hundreds of Hondurans have decided enough is enough and are heading north to the United States.

item.title: This virtual concert is to commemorate Ingrid's 3rd year...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

This virtual concert is to commemorate Ingrid's 3rd year living in sanctuary. There will be different musicians from across the United States sharing their talent with us. The goal of the event is to fundraise $3,000 for the personal expenses Ingrid will have during this holiday season. A part of this money Ingrid will be donating to kids who live in the mountains of Peru where she is from and where her parents still live.

The concert will be on zoom so please register with ...this link - https://forms.gle/TiD3UDX3H6agtLKn9

You will receive the zoom link for the concert the morning of Dec. 13th. If you are unable to attend, but would still like to support Ingrid, you can donate on her GoFundMe
(https://www.gofundme.com/f/virtual-benefit-concert-for-ingr…) or send her a donation directly by Venmo at @Ingrid-Encalada

See More

SUN, DEC 13

Virtual Benefit Concert for Ingrid Encalada Latorre

Online EventCauses · 116 people

item.title: A second Louisville protester named Kris Smith has been shot and...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

A second Louisville protester named Kris Smith has been shot and killed following the death of another local activist named Travis Nagdy.

In the weeks and years following the Ferguson Uprising, activists were also mysteriously murdered one by one.

We condemn these assassinations and the movement for Black liberation is not gonna stop! 🖤🥀

A second Louisville protester has been shot and killed following the death of local activist Travis Nagdy.

thegrio.com

Louisville protester Kris Smith fatally shot weeks after death of BLM activist

item.title: "Pham also led an agency that struggled to contain COVID-19...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

"Pham also led an agency that struggled to contain COVID-19 outbreaks within detention centers holding immigrants. Several ICE detainees who tested positive for COVID-19 have died in government custody this year.

In October, ICE officials also began implementing a policy that allows officers to arrest and rapidly deport undocumented immigrants who have been in the US for less than two years. Pham said officers and agents needed to finish a training course by Oct. 16, after which they could begin using their new authority."

Tony Pham, a refugee from Vietnam, oversaw an effort to plaster billboards with the faces of immigrants along highways in Pennsylvania.

buzzfeednews.com

ICE’s Controversial Leader Plans To Resign After Five Months On The Job

Tony Pham, a refugee from Vietnam, oversaw an effort to plaster billboards with the faces of immigrants along highways in Pennsylvania.Tony Pham, a refugee from Vietnam, oversaw an effort to plaster billboards with the faces of immigrants along highways in Pennsylvania.

It’s in Five Points and it’s of Nga Vuong-Sandoval, a refugee who fled Vietnam with her family as a child — and who now advocates for the rights of other refugees and immigrants.

"Muslim bans" existed long before Trump and were carried out by both Bush and Obama.

The case – Tanzin v Tanvir — involved three Muslim men who said their religious-freedom rights were violated when FBI agents tried to use the no-fly list to force them into becoming informants.

item.title: Brandon Bernard, whose death row case drew frantic pleas for...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

Brandon Bernard, whose death row case drew frantic pleas for mercy from activists around the country has been executed by lethal injection. He was 40 years old.

His death marks the ninth federal execution this year.

vice.com

Brandon Bernard Was Just Put to Death In Trump's Unprecedented Push for Executions

His death marks the ninth federal execution this year.His death marks the ninth federal execution this year.

item.title: ICE agents are vile, lying thugs. The only goal of ICE as a...
item.content:encoded:
Abolish ICE Denver

ICE agents are vile, lying thugs. The only goal of ICE as a state agency is to harm people, instill terror, and wreck lives. The people who make up the ranks of ICE are enemies of humanity, and the long but inevitable arc of justice will judge them accordingly.

"A common tactic that accompanies this ruse is under public scrutiny once again. This time, in New York where a man who has been a resident of the city for over 30 years was apprehended in October 2020. Agents waited ...outside of his job as a chef in Harlem after his wife was confronted at their home. ICE agents identified themselves to her as police at the couples’ apartment and showed her a photo of another man, not her husband. They led her to believe that there was an honest mix-up and if she helped them identify her husband, she would in effect be resolving the case of mistaken identity. After they received the identifying information that they needed from her which included his cell phone number, the agents arrested Fernando Santos-Rodriguez at the restaurant where he was arriving to begin his morning shift."

https://imm-print.com/ice-agents-step-up-deceptive-tactics…/

See MoreBeware: ICE endorses the practice of their agents falsely posing as police officers in order to gain access to homes, spread confusion and apprehend immigrants.

imm-print.com

ICE Agents Step Up Deceptive Tactics To Detain Immigrants

Beware: ICE endorses the practice of their agents falsely posing as police officers in order to gain access to homes, spread confusion and apprehend immigrants.Beware: ICE endorses the practice of their agents falsely posing as police officers in order to gain access to homes, spread confusion and apprehend immigrants.
